reviewText: For my own personal progress in this game scroll near to the bottom for lists of STUFF!\n\nI will be reveiwing Clicker Heroes" today. Keep in mind that I've played countless hours of this game soley on the browser version and so my current number of hours does not represent my knowledge on the game. However
date:
I admittedly haven't played in a while. I did a quick recap of this game on steam and it hasn't changed much.

Let me start out with stating the fact that there is a bizarely shocking number of people who dislike this game for various reasons. Let me list some common reasons I've seen in the reviews on the Steam version of the game and a short response to each one.

1) The game is basically cookie clicker with microtransactions.

Response: So what? First off - it's completely free to play. If you knew what cookie clicker is and how it did things you know this game is all about grinding gold and such to get upgrades to your clicks. Furthermore
recommended:
you don't even have to do anything to rack up gold in this game after a certain point. You literally don't need to "play" it. This is achievement grinder 2015.

2) The game has no "skill" or anything involved. "It's just clicking!"

Response: Pull your head out of your ♥♥♥ promptly. Please locate the part in the description of this game where it says this is a "Highly skill based game!" and then I'll get back to you. It's as casual as it gets
hoursPlayed:
truly.

3) Pay to Win.

Response: AHAHAHAHAHA oh god. Please! Please!

4) It's easy to just cheat so what's the point?

Response: I don't know. If you feel like breaking a game and finding ways to cheat in it (IE: getting an auto clicker of sorts) that's your own thing. Truly
voteText: who gives a damn? This isn't an MMO
helpfulPercent: this isn't Call of Duty. You're only cheating yourself out of hours upon hours of "riveting" gameplay. This game is meant to be casual in the first place
votesHelpful:
so do us all a favor and stop your ♥♥♥♥♥ing please and thank you.

--------------------------------------------------------

Now that that's out of the way let me touch on what this game advertizes and offers up front to you
votesTotal:
the consumer.

-Ascend to be able to have DPS's of up to " one quadrillion damage per second ".
-Know how " one quadrillion damage per second" feels.
-Click on monsters to kill them and get gold (virtual) for it.
-Hire heroes to deal more damage which in turn will up your kills per minute
votesFunny:
which ups your gold per minute in general.
-"Meet" legendary figures such as Athena. 35 unique heroes to hire.
-Make your MMO character's feel like kindergarteners because of their damage per second's.
-Spend your "hard earned loot" to upgrade your heroes and gain special abilities from them.
-Over 100 different monsters
column16: including boss creatures.\n-Earn gold while you're idle. No clicking required if you have heroes! Earn while you do the laundrey
column18: looking at these features the game seems to offer most of them. To be honest
column19: I haven't put in the play time to verify some of these features but at this point and time I trust the developers on their numbers. I don't think they'd lie to me about what they advertised in their game. 35 unique heroes
column20: I'm sure there are. Over 100 monsters? Great! I'll be counting and I'll compile a list and update this at a later date. I haven't gotten to nearly anywhere near one quadrillion dps but I'm sure it's possible given one of the acheivements for this game is to reach zone 2400 (or something)
column21: which would - given my experience - require a "metric f*ck ton" of damage per second to beat anything there.\n\nSo far I recommend this game. That may change if I find the features to be lacking compared to what was advertised. Far too often people expect far too much from a game when the developers didn't even advertise it. A game shouldn't be based on anything other than what the developers advertise regarding a rating. That being said
column22: a game can be flat out crap and even broken. However
column23:
this game is none of that.

Clicker heroes is a very well done super casual game with all the tools a casual gamer could ever want to use as well as plenty of acheivements to complete and many other things to aquire in game for you collectionists and completionists out there. Even if your interaction with the game is minimal you can still enjoy getting achievements.

Clicker heroes will receive a high rating from me for a few reasons. First off
column24: I genuinely enjoyed it. It's cute
column25: it's a light bit of fun and can be worth the expresso shots to wake you up in the morning after a hard
column26: long night of advancing your quest to get carpel tunnel syndrome from clicking like a mad man with multiple fingers on multiple hands and feet. No one is there to call you a noob
column27: tell you to uninstall or learn to play
column28: because it's not targetted at an audience such as that. So
column30: it knows who it's marketing to. It doesn't claim to be a "skill based game" or any nonsense like that. It doesn't claim to have great graphics (though it does deliver on it's lovely art style)
column31: or have fantastically new and intriguing features or have a world that has you immersed BallsDeep in it's riveting and in depth storyline and world.\n\nIt's just a fun
column32: casual time waster based on clicking the same spot hundreds upon thousands of times
column33:
or farming gold from your heroes and making the odd update here and there.

For these reasons I give this game a TEHN AOUTTA TEHN!

Now

for my current list of achievements and other information I've gotten from playing the game.

Here we go again...

Not my favourite of the genre, but I was having an anxiety freakout last night and it was the exact sort of soothing repetitive background task I needed.  (I don't really actively play, so much as keep an eye on it and poke things sometimes.  YMMV.)

All in all a solid endless progression game, though some of the jokes are cruel rather than funny; I'd recommend not reading the flavour text.  Destructively brain-eating if you let it have full sway, but as a mental health tool it's super useful.

reviewText:
Clicker Heroes is a clicker game where you click on monsters and spend your reward money on hiring and improving more heroes to fight the continually stonger monsters. Basically, you click on monsters to get gold. You use the gold to buy and upgrade heroes. And through clicking, damage over time, and certain activated abilities you try to kill more and more to get further. There are bosses every so many rounds. You can ascend the world which starts you over but gives you a special kind of currency called hero souls. Having them raises your damage over time, but you can spend them for greater enhancements in the game. You can also sometimes find rubies, another type of currency you can use to buy certain enhancements to your game. Aside from a few other things... that's about it.

It's a lot of rinse and repeat gameplay. Lots of clicking, lots of idling, lots of waiting. Sometimes you'll leave it up in the background while other times you won't play for days just to earn lots of extra gold. Sometimes you'll have to keep checking back to make progress or do this or that. Ultimately it's pretty mindless. Honestly, it's not a very good game. It doesn't require any skill because you can never LOSE progress outside of hard restting all the data. Getting better at the game basically means following guides, working out math involved in damage to cost ratios, and timing your playing schedule accordingly. It's more like a time waster. It's a chore. It turns into just another thing you do because you do it.

I like the theming of the game. Using heroes to fight off monsters, getting gold, growing stronger somewhat like an RPG almost. But the gameplay comes down to math, making decisions, knowing when to be on or when to idle, and clicking. That's it. It's pretty dull. This works fine... as an app. It's something you can pull up and kill some time on here and there. But devoting time to playing it is just so dull and a waste. As an app, it's fine. As a GAME, it's bad.

So why recommend it? Well, it's FREE! You CAN pay money to get extra stuff and make it go faster, but there's no need to. It's a large waste of time, unless you have fun with it. So if the idea interests you, give it a shot and see how you feel about it. There's nothing stopping you. However, I'd recommend getting the app on your phone instead and just doing it to kill time rather than playing it like a game. There are plenty of free games on the internet and many of them are more fun as actual games. I played this one long enough myself. Giving it a score, I'll have to rate it as a GAME, because I'm a game reviewer, not an app reviewer and it's being presented here on Steam, a gaming platform, as a game. Clicker Heroes gets a 2 out of 10 for being a free thing to do in your spare time that is bound to get old. At least it's free, so you might as well see for yourself.

reviewText:
If you enjoy getting hand cramps, replacing your mouse, and watching numbers go up, then this is the game for you! As one of the most interactive games ever, Clicker Heroes allows you to annihilate your enemies with just the click(s) of your mouse! You don't even need to think to play this game. Simply hover your mouse over an enemy, close your eyes, and enjoy the sounds of frantic clicking and the euphoric sensation of your finger spazzing the hell out. Then experience the wonderful feeling of having to replace your dead mouse with a completely new one!

Pros:
-Lots of numbers to keep you happy
-No brain function required
-The game does the math for you
-You have the opportunity to buy a new mouse every week
-Finger workouts are a bonus
-You'll never be bored again

Cons:
-There is no tutorial on how to click your mouse so you'll have to teach yourself

reviewText:
Ah yes, to think I was sitting here thinking I was over my addiction to Cookie Clicker, then this rolls up and decides to draw me in the same. I've sat for hours just watching this game go by already, clicking now and again in between my breaks to rinse my wrists under cold water and wrap ice around them.

This game is highly addictive, one of those simple ones that seem to draw you in for more and more. Enjoy waking your room mates up with endless *click click click click* of your mouse as you crave to build up each of those heroes, so you can click even more. A cruel cycle, but a fun one.

Overall an enjoyable game, that is also nice to have running in the background as you do other things to try and distract yourself from it, but I guarantee you will check upon it again... and again... and again...

reviewText: I've spent more time on Clicker Heroes than I would prefer to admit. I first started playing to see what all the hype was about after getting involved with the Steam Summer Monster Event. Then I figured I'd just play a little more for the sake of achievement whoring. But the game has an addictive element that sucked me in to just kill one more boss, but that was 200 bosses ago...The more I play, the more I begin to realize that it really never ends. The game keeps throwing insane exponentials of hit points making those 1 million percent damage upgrades I just acquired useless. At a certain point the element of monster clicking is lost and sheer hero DPS upgrades takes over. It's a good time sink if you have nothing better to do. So why does it continue to consume all this time when I have so many better things to do?

reviewText:
A few minutes into the game your clicks will become worthless as your minions do a significantly higher amount of damage over time than your clicks ever will.  As soon as you buy the next level minion, all other minions become useless. The number values for each minion increase by stupidly high amounts that you'll be doing quintillion damage a second in a short amount of time, and then you'll be doing damage with values you've never heard of before.

The game plays itself when you aren't playing it, so the only use you are to the game is to buy the next level minion, quit, and come back in a couple days.

It's essentially a fully automated Cookie Clicker" based game with little incentive to do anything at all. In-game currency (Gems) are worthless
voteText: each new character you buy is super over powered (until you buy the next one
helpfulPercent: then it becomes obsolete) and your time spent "playing" this game is 100% wasted."

reviewText:
First, Clicker Heroes starts out like a thing to just check occasionally.
Then you realise there's actually a way to get the premium currency, by clicking on clickables.
And that's when you start OCD checking the game every few seconds.
And then, AFTER that, you realise you need to buy another upgrade.
But before you can put it away, since it's been almost enough time for another clickable to spawn, you decide to wait.
And with THAT gold you decide to buy another hero.
Then you see a Relic Ooze as you hover over the 'x' in the corner.
You check the stats and realise you need to equip it because it's way better than your current one.
And THEN, another clickable spawns, so you buy some gilded heroes.
And one of them happens to be the next hero you're about to buy.
So you wait for the money. And then you buy it.
That's when you realise it's time to ascend again, so you start leveling heroes.
Right as you finish another clickable spawns!
And straight after that, a bee at the zone bar spawns too.
Then you're far enough to ascend. So you do.
Then you decide to get back up to the same stage as before.

15/1 would stay up until 7 in the morning again.

reviewText:
Very fun game, extremely addictive. Has some micro transactions but nothing major ( more for convenience as you can earn the currency for these items just by playing)

I went into the game with no idea what to do, you pick it up very quickly and after about 10 minutes you'll find yourself hooked, looking around for little birds and praying for rubies.

They have several little additives like mercs, relics and other little things that can increase damage or the various currencies including an acension system which basically resets your progress while providing catchup mechanics and other goodies (NG+ etc).

Loving it so far and can't leave it alone.

reviewText:
*starts playing at 10:00 A.M*
Oh look it's already 11:00 P.M.


Serious Review:Clicker Heroes is a fun clicker that will leave your hand numb if you play this for the whole day. Unless you have a lot of heroes at your side.


Positives
1.) This game has a replay value as you can reset.
2.) You can join guilds/clans to group up to kill immortals.
3.) You don't need to click a lot as you can hire NPCs to do it for you.


Cons
1.) The game gets repetitive as you keep resetting.
2.) The immortals get stronger and get more impossible evertime you kill them.
3.) You will need to click most of the times as NPCs aren't enough.
4.) This game is heavily relied on grinding.

reviewText: I'm a big fan of idle games, I played" Cookie Clicker and other less well known incremental games like Derivative Clicker.\n\nThe hook that gets you into the game is the satisfaction of mindlessly spamming a button so you can save up for upgrades and do more and more DPS to kill tougher and tougher creatures. In actual fact
date:
the fun in the game for me (as a fan of the genre) is in optimising the build order to reach the end game faster.

Looking at the maths involved to help decide what is the best thing to buy or save for at any given time from an efficiency perspective and whether or not you are wanting a build designed for pure idling or for more active clicking is where a lot of the fun comes for me. Watching the deepz grow is just a nice side effect of that!

It's a fundamentally pointless game
recommended: and I certainly won't be taking part in the micro transactions (I'd rather just pay a fiver for the game instead
voteText: but for a few hours of clicking it's certainly fun and if you get into the end game mechanics of it all and the soft reset function that is seen in many of the more developed idling games
helpfulPercent: then it has a lot more depth than you'd initially think."

reviewText:
Why did I download did game?
How have I managed to log over 160 hours of clicking?
What makes this so incredibly addicting?

The answer to all of the above: I honestly don't know.

Pros:
Controls: Left click (lots of it), Ctrl, Z, Shift
Easy to understand mechanics
Few screens
Rubies (real money item) can be obtained in game

Cons:
Graphics are not outstanding (however this does not take away from the game)
Can get monotonous after a while (having a device for your free hand while you click is preferable)

The game entails lots of clicking, nothing else. A minion on the right of the screen appears and after killing it, it is replaced by another until the zone is cleared. Every 5 levels a mini boss appears and every 10 levels a zone boss appears.  You get heroes to help you add DPS to your clicking which makes clicking do more damage, and your heroes get skills which you unlock with the gold from killing the minions you endlessly click on.

Very addictive after a while if you get into it. I hope you enjoy it.

reviewText: I started this game seeing some of my friends playing, after having fallen in love with the idle genre. I figured it would be just like every other idle game, and for the most part it was. Seeing each and every hero pop up after affording the previous one I became hooked on playing the game on and on. I would not stop playing the game, constantly upgrading my heroes and ascending, never finding the time to actually be idle except between ascensions. The music is really unbearable and repetative and the sound that plays when you roll over coins is cringy after a while. I quickly became addctid to the Clicker Heroes lifestyle, and still am. All in all, I recommend never wasting your time with this game, it will ruin your life and is not worth. Now I need to go to the hospital to get some of my fingers reattached.

reviewText:
Been playing this game for a long time for free ever since it came out on flash sites and for me clicker heroes is the ultimate idle game. Kill monsters, collect gold, upgrade heroes, use skills, find treasure, kill bosses and explore new worlds.

Very active devs that keep balancing the game and adding new features, huge plus to them.
The feeling of progression whenever u play or idle and how this all results in more hero souls to progress even more gives a  great feeling.

It's not just clicking and upgrading there are actually strategies about who to buy and when and also the first heroes, once u make them lv 1000 they get important again in the same run which makes me say this is some great gamedesign and balancing.

And well since i needed a new mouse anyway and not wanted too thow my old one out without it breaking down, this was the best game to actually break it. This game was actually also a good stress reliever, instead of hitting my pillow when im angry i can spam click my mouse till i can't click anymore and get tired and fall asleep.

So since the game offers all this and is free, i highly  suggest to give it a try!

reviewText:
Addictive, but casual medium-fun game.

Recommended to read guidelines and strategy's. Otherwise you run into walls (levels 140 Through 180, read below what i did after i discovered how the game was played :))

Get ready to waste your  mousebutton and both hands.
The faster you click, the faster you go through the game.

you start with nothing, click to hit a monster, click several times to waste it.
10 monsters per level, every 5 levels, a boss.
Then a timer starts, you got 30 seconds to get rid of ridiculous amounst of hitpoints.
The you can get hero's to click for you...Damage Per Second...
Slay a monster, get money, classic hack and loot..
buy levels for your heroes to get enormous bonussen to DPS and clicks.

sounds easy? It is!
Still the game has enough dept with magic items, ancient souls, hero souls and special abilities you gather during the game to do even more damage...think decillions of damage..

When you'll find it harder to get past the normal levels, after al while, you can Restart...every time this happens, you gather souls for more bonus, to get you past these levels...onto more difficult levels to pass...and so you go round and round and faster and faster...
The is no limit...and to get beyond it, you'll have to start over and over again..and again..

I would only recommend this game when
- you're not sensitive to any addictions
- you have no wife
- you have no kids
- you have plently of time
- you have no life, other than to ravage your mousebutton..

STRATEGY SPOILER>>> how i did it..after i clicked 500000 times..
(how it should be done)

1st time:
get ready to click...
get to level 120, buy as much levels for every hero to get around 10 souls when you ascend the first time.
dont buy ancients...yet...the bonus 10% per soul is much bigger than the bonus from ancients at this stage..

You will notice that with a 100% damage bonus, you will get past the first set of levels much more easily...

Now try to make it to level 120...buy as many levels as possible and hope for extra souls from primal bosses.
ascend...
again and again..
enough gems? buy 3 guilds,

when you get past level 140 things slow down...
gather as much souls as possible untill you reach 200 souls...never go below this amount.

now try to buy CHRONOS level to 3-4-5 and SIYALATAS level to 20, buy some other totems if you like..but dont spend more souls on ancients if it takes you below 200..

the go for 400 souls...
In the mean time,  try gathering Magical items that increase the chance of primal souls...

frostbite level 75? after level 140...
start with treebeast and level him to 1000...
then the next..
if you have got several guild bonusses, you can level these heroes as well..every 25 levels damage goes 4X...
the samoerai is pretty strong...in this phase of the game..

level 160 and 165 are hard...for the money you get...
i stopped at this point almost every time..to get past you have to leave the game @ level 159...
than upgrade per 25 levels...try to see which one is the best buy...

because you start over and over...you gather 10-30 gems per ascension..untill you have 400 and the descibed levels..

when goin into clickmode..you can easily slay beyond 150---do this to get the free guilds every 10 levels..but dont go to the max every time...
i had runs with only Omeet as 1 primal soul...the next run you end up with over 30 on bosses alone..

try yo reach level 200 more often...the boss has 8 souls..every time..

Then leave the game for the night beyond level 240...you might have to click to get beyond te last few bosses...
by that time you level heroes per 25 levels for 10 ^ 35...
when you get there, you get beyond 10 ^40 over night....

The first 6 heroes are beyond level 1000...by that time...

Rearrange guilds, some heroes are weaker, and not needed...select samoerai, treebeast, mercedes...to concentrate 4-6 guilds in them..
it really helps if other heroes are guilded as well..keep at least 1 guilded and 2 not guilded...
be carefull...it cost 2 souls per time...only do this if you go to level 150 faster than 20 minutes.

Enjoy :)

reviewText: While I've only just downloaded the Steam version, I've been playing the browser version for over a month. And I think it's important to stress: this isn't a game you should actively play. This is the gaming equivalent of a fish tank. Drop some food in every once in a while, watch the number shoot up, and then go back to doing something productive.\n\nI've always loved idle games like Cookie Clicker, Candy Box, A Dark Room, ect. And if you got suckered into those, I have good news: this is the best one, especially given that it's getting continual updates. It has fun flavor text on all the heroes and upgrades, a decent music track for the thirty seconds before you turn it off, and a heap of personality. And if you like those games" already
date: you don't need this review. Download it
hoursPlayed: then come back. It's the same itch you need scratch.\n\nIt's not for everyone. Not at all. And I don't think reviews have stressed that enough thus far. The game can be boring
voteText: just because there's so little to do. And even though I find satisfaction in my goal to summon every ancient (I'm only five away from completion)
helpfulPercent: I know not everyone else will.  But this is a niche game for a niche set of people
votesHelpful: who like to have something goofy to check on every so often while writing a paper
votesTotal: or waiting for a bus
column16: but they've been around for eons- recent patches have only made them more obvious. They're inoffensive and totally ignorable. And the developer is obviously capable
column17: seeing as the Greenlight project was announced and delivered upon in the few short weeks I've been messing around with this. I personally don't buy into them because they feel like cheating
column18: though I'm eager to find other ways to support this game since it's scratched my itch so well. The feature where it tracks progress even while closed is applaudable enough. That's a revolution for this "genre."\n\nIt's free to download
column20: and even faster to decide if it's for you or not. It can be a dark hole to fall into
column21: so please remember to exercise caution. But if you have the self-control to enjoy it in moderation
column22: Clicker Heroes is a lot of bang for no buck.\n\nGood luck
column23: and may your mouse be made of steel."

reviewText: This game is incredibly addictive even if its sole promise is to repeteadly click on the enmies to damage them and get the gold they drop after being defeated to hire helpers that damage the enemies each second and improve their damage (or your damage per click); money can also be spent on buying special powers for your helpers. The game's most noticeable feature is how losing on standard enemies is absolutely impossible, the only way you can lose is to Boss battles (as they are timed), so you'll have to defeat older enemies many times to grind power-ups and defeat the Boss. Repeat this every 5 stages and you get most of the game, the fact that it can run in background and litterally play itself is pretty incredible and amusing (even when your PC isn't running, just go to sleep and the next day you'll be able to witness the gigantic amount of money your helpers have gaigned when you were asleep; wich is always somehow surprising...).
